description: This file implements the core functions for a Web Resource Locator Object, including object creation, deletion, object enrollment, and initialization. It defines how the object is created, set up, finalized, and wired with URI path handling, serving as part of a web server or application system.

classes.name: WEB_RESOURCE_LOCATOR_OBJECT
classes.description: The main object representing the Web Resource Locator, containing methods and properties for managing URI paths and lifecycle.

methods.name: ANSC_HANDLE WebRloCreate(ANSC_HANDLE hContainerContext,ANSC_HANDLE hOwnerContext,ANSC_HANDLE hAnscReserved)
methods.description: Constructs a new Web Resource Locator object, allocating memory, initializing core properties and function pointers.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS WebRloRemove(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Destroys the Web Resource Locator object, freeing allocated resources and performing cleanup.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS WebRloEnrollObjects(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Enrolls and initializes sub-objects required by the locator, such as URI path objects.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS WebRloInitialize(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Initializes the object, setting default properties, function pointers, and preparing it for use.
